meanings.definition: Having a pink or reddish color.
meanings.sent1: The sunset painted the sky a rosy hue.
meanings.sent2: She wore a rosy dress to the party.
meanings.sent3: The rosy flowers in the garden seemed to blush in the sunlight.
meanings.sent4: The rosy cheeks of the child showed the excitement of Christmas morning.
meanings.sent5: The rosy petals of the rose glistened with morning dew.

meanings.sent1: The rosy forecast predicted a sunny day ahead.
meanings.sent2: Despite the challenges, she maintained a rosy outlook on life.
meanings.sent3: The rosy promise of a snow day made the students cheer.
meanings.sent4: The rosy opportunity to travel abroad filled her with joy.
meanings.sent5: The rosy possibilities of the future inspired him to work hard.

meanings.sent1: After exercise, her cheeks were rosy from the exertion.
meanings.sent2: The hiker's rosy complexion showed she enjoyed the outdoors.
meanings.sent3: The rosy glow of his face after a run made him look vibrant.
meanings.sent4: The rosy appearance of the fruit indicated its freshness.
meanings.sent5: Her rosy skin after a good night's sleep made her look rejuvenated.
